Reviews.Title: “Very good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: AhlanM
Reviews.Content: The ideal hotel if you are attending a conference at the adjacent conference centre or for some reason need to be in the Dahlem area. It is some way out from central Berlin however five minutes walk to the U3 Metro station means that you can easily get into town but it takes time. The hotel is otherwise excellent - large comfortable beds in reasonable size room, spotlessly clean. I found the hotel nice and quiet but I suspect that that might be due to there not being many people staying there when I did. Immediately after check-in I did hear quite clearly a business women in the room next door ranting loudly on the telephone and so feared the worst. But I never heard her or anyone else since that one occasion. Maybe i was lucky and she checked out? All the staff were nice and very helpful, even when trying to solve problems that weren't anything to do with the hotel. So fully marks there! The complementary wifi worked ok but always times out after 10 minutes of inactivity requiring going to the router home page and reentering a username and password in order to continue using the internet - This during a business meeting was very tedious. Also the toilets are a long way from the bar, restaurant and meeting rooms. Also a bit tedious.

Reviews.Title: “Industrial chic”
Reviews.Author: ChiFT
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the evening, stayed the night, checked out next morning - typical arrangement when I travel to Europe for meetings. I would describe the hotel as industrial chic - glass stairways, metal stairs, glass lifts, exposed lift shafts, glass facade etc. Rooms are functional although the decor is not like any typical hotel - they have obviously put some thoughts into it so it doesnt just look like another Holiday Inn or Mercure. It is sort of "ikea" but a bit more stylish. It is comfortably enough for business travel, but the bed is not quite as comfortable as most hotels I have stayed in the US. The wired internet didnt work (couldnt get connected and I must admit this sort of problem is getting rare these days in the hotels I have stayed recently) and couldnt managed to control the room temperature (turning it cooler seemed to make it warmer). The breakfast was fine - fairly typical of what you get in a similar class hotel in Germany. On the whole, not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for comfort if the location works for you”
Reviews.Author: Bob4er
Reviews.Content: The building is new, the rooms are spacious in a metal-and-glass style, and a very reasonable room rate included a generous breakfast buffet and wireless Internet. As I was attending a conference at the Free University, for me the location was ideal as well. A train stop on the U-bahn (subway) is a short walk away, but you're half an hour from the ciy center in a relatively sleepy area; so for a sightseeing trip you may want a closer-in, more exciting location, even though you won't get as good a deal for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A very decent conference hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gmce02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a leafy Berlin suburb near the Free University campus. It is a quiet location and the principle reason for most people to stay here seemed to be university related business or a conference being hosted at the venue. Breakfast was generous and the hotel is modern, the rooms comfortable and quiet. All in all very pleasant. The hotel is close to the UBahn station, so it could be used for a more touristy stay. But there are more interesting locations (and cheaper hotels) in Berlin. There is not much in the way of night life in the surrounding areas and restaurants in the neighbourhood are rather limited.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectation”
Reviews.Author: Juretennis1
Reviews.Content: i stayed for the first time in this hotel, attending a congress in the conference center nearby. First the rooms are very well equipped, and nicely maintained. Staff is extremely friendly. I could check in at 10 am in the morning already. No extra fees for wireless internet access, what a nice difference to most other so called "business hotels". Breakfast was fine, good number of choices. In short walking distance the center of "Dahlem" are high quality community environment. You do not feel as staying in a countrie's capital with millions of inhabitants. Even public transport is nearby, the station with a shelf roof looks really pretty. Transfer from Tegel aiprot is 15-20 minif traffic is not too busy. prices are very reasonably considering what you get for them. A clear recommendation from my side and I will definitely book a room again on my next visit to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Getting a 5 star value for a 3-4 star price!”
Reviews.Author: stpMike
Reviews.Content: If the phrase 'value for money' is used to describe a hotel, then Seminaris Campushotel Berlin is the place. We stayed here for 4 days and found the reception service impeccable from day one. The room provided was comfortable and roomy, even for two. Same goes to the bathroom. Internet access is provided complimentary. A safe is provided too. Finally, the hotel has simply the best breakfast buffet spread you can find for its price class.The only downside is that the windows doesn't have much of a view, but the unique structure of the building probably will compensate for this. Tips: There's a Bahn station (Dahlem Dorf) less than 5 minutes away walking distance from the hotel to connect you to the city. I like the shoplot in the station selling pastries and cakes. You can also find a Doner kebab stall in front of the station. For those looking for convenience store, Kaisers is located around 5 minutes walk across the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and easy”
Reviews.Author: Bunnie084
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my 3 day Berlin adventure, This hotel is extremely new and nice located next to a university campus. The hotel is new and is very well setup the staff are friendly and the area is great. You have a metro station at the end of the street and there is a pub ( with good food & reasonable price) there is also a supermarket several cafe`s and banks too and a pharmacy. The hotel is about 30 mins for alexanderplatz which is where all the major tour companies leave from. ( is best to get on the ring train as its faster than the actual subway) The breakfast is one of the best ive had for free ever! Pros: Nice area Easy to get to Berlin new modern building GREAT BREAKFAST! Cons: Hotels internet does not work very well i had to ask for access to the conference center internet The blinds don't work very well in the room The rooms are not very well sound proofed

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: karlydev
Reviews.Content: I was traveling alone (single woman in early 30's) to Berlin for business. This hotel was easy to get to from Tegel airport. A quick hop on a bus and then an easy straight route to the hotel. Hotel is situated in a beautiful town near the Free University of Berlin called Dalhem. Room was plesant and very clean. Modern comfort and new feel. I felt extremely comfortable. The hotel is about a 25 minute subway ride into Berlin center. This is not really bad as you can get used to the subway and transportation in Berlin easily without speaking German. It is worth staying a bit out of the way for a quiet atmosphere of safety and comfort. There are 3 nice restaurants within a very short walking distance from the hotel. Two serve traditional German fare and the other is a great authentic Italian place with nice, lighted outside seating. If you are looking for privacy, safety, and comfort this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Seminaris Campus hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katrina_SA1
Reviews.Content: Clean, lots of windows (love it) and spacious room, no bath only shower. Food was the best

Reviews.Title: “a remote newly-built conference-type hotel”
Reviews.Author: anna_austrian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not so far from some university campus and is dedicated mainly for conferences, so has a fine conference facilities. Otherwise the location is a bit remote from everything else in Berlin. Suitable for getting away with colleagues. Sometimes there are several conferences going on in parallel, and it's tricky to book the hotel to stay on the conference site, or anything else close enough. It has a restaurant/catering place on site and a bar, the quality of meals and drinks are ok. The living rooms are small - mainly for sleeping, not really living. They have huge glass windows on the outside (meant to be fashion?), so that people from the outside can see you. As the hotel has been built relatively recently, everything there is still in order/in a good condition. One can park freely on the street next to the hotel, that's a plus!

Reviews.Title: “impressive architecture”
Reviews.Author: fritzrudolf
Reviews.Content: location next to the Freie Universität campus in Berlin Dahlem, very beautiful simplistic modern architecture (Jahn) with large class fronts and thoughtful installations, clean and convenient rooms, weakness during my stay: the breakfast buffet and the reception in the morning were quite crowded, and the breakfast wasnt impressive

Reviews.Title: “Nice brand new place, nice area....”
Reviews.Author: MrSpeyk
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice brand new hotel only 20 minutes out of the city on the metro which is just around the corner. Service is good and the rooms are clean. Prices are reasonable, mini bar beer 2.60 euros, internet 5 euros for the first hour each day and 1 euro there after. It is a conference location but would also suit any traveler, you can use public transport at any time to get back from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaSofie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not exactly situated in the centre of Berlin, but still I found it comfortably close to all the sights. It's 20 minutes by bus to the centre of former West-Berlin and 200 metres from the Dahlem Dorf U-bahn, from which you can easily (12-15 min) get to Wittenbergplatz and from there it's only a few minutes by bus to Potsdamer Platz, Brandenburger Tor and Unter Den Linden. The Dahlem area itself is also worth a visit; it's a very cosy and lush neighborhood with numerous italian trettorias and berliner biergardens. "Louise" is a lovely Biergarden just around the corner, which also serves exellent salads and pizzas and other international dishes. The Seminaris Campus hotel is stylish, modern and relaxed at the same time and meets any demand or expectations you might have. Would recommend it to anyone going to Berlin, wheter it's for business or leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Great for conference, not so great for sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: mito143
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business trip. Was great to have the conference rooms in a separate building, but close enough to nip back to the room if needed in between meetings. It was very hot in the building as their is so much glass and it will be even hotter in the summer. However they have planted vines outside and once these have grown, this will be an incredibly nice place to stay for business. However I do not recommend this hotel as a base for sight-seeing in Berlin, as it is too far out from the centre.

HotelInfo.Name: Seminaris CampusHotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Takustrasse 39 | Opening 16. March 2009, 14195 Berlin, Germany
